name: climatologically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the climate (= general or long-term weather conditions) of a place, or to the scientific study of climate: Climatologically, Greece has two main seasons. Today the area is climatologically diverse. Climatologically speaking, when sea surface temperatures are elevated, then hurricanes are more likely to form, and may be more severe.
More examplesFewer examplesSeptember opened climatologically with high temperatures around 20 degrees celsius and overnight lows between six and nine celsius.The period between 950–500 BCE was climatologically marked by instability.
